result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac R. Luther was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed. No possession of controlled substances except for prescriptions as prescribed.

AODA w/ follow up.
Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
2 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for work/treatment if eligible.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.  

No going upon any premises whose primary business is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  

Payment of outstanding costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:32 pm 
INCLUDES 16CF20, 15CF960, 15CF699, and 16CF951. 
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Deft appears in person with Atty Richard Bender. 

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 16CF20 and 15CF960. 
Argument. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 16CF20: Ct. 1>> 6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC and 3 years ES. 
                 : Ct. 2>> 6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC and 3 years ES. 
                 : Ct. 3>> 6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC and 3 years ES. 
In 15CF960: Ct. 1>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC and 3 years ES. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the department; fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; no going upon any premises whose primary business is the sale of alcoholic beverages; payment of outstanding costs. 

COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT. 
COURT finds the deft entitled to 426 days jail credit in 16CF20 and 243 days jail credit in 15CF960. 
COURT finds the deft NOT eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT remands deft into the custody of the MCSD for transport. 

STC set for 5/30/2017 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA in 15CF699 and 16CF951. 
Adj: 4:06 pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 14, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 23, 2017 at 09:15 am.
Atty. Richard Bender
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 27, 2017 at 08:15 am.

with documents from DOC (sent to BR3)

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 4:18 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF699, 15CF757, 15CF960, AND 16CF20. 
State appears by Intern Davis Runde with DDA Theresa Wetzseteon; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman.  
State requests jury trial be set in 15CF699. 

PLEA HEARING IN 15CF757, 15CF960, AND 16CF20.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF757: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF960: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF960: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 16CF20: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                  : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                  : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 4 years probation - CONDITIONS on all: maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed; no possesion of controlled substances except prescriptions as prescribed; AODA and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITION On Ct. 1 in 15CF960 ONLY: 30 days MCJ with huber for work/treatment if eligible;

COURT finds the def entitled to 205 days jail credit in 16CF20 and 2 days jail credit in 15CF960 if revoked. 

Atty Bachman requests speedy trial in 15CF699. 
CC set for 8/10/2016 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA to set jury trial. 
Adj: 4:38 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 4, 2016 at 04:05 pm.
